Concept ACK. I'd prefer using a limit that is actually testable, though. 16MB sounds good.

> which at worst would just make things a bit slow.

It could also crash the application with an out-of-memory error, or running out of virtual memory when compiled for 32-bit.

The largest p2p message type is a 4 MB block? With hex encoding that should be 8 MB. Wrapped again in json, that should be less than 16 MB.\n\nBtw doc is here: https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qlineedit.html#maxLength-prop
@laanwj @MarcoFalke thanks! changed to 16MB and first tests ok

Suggest `std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()` as it's the standard for size limits.  I'm also not really sure a 2GB buffer makes sense here, but then again, what is a sane amount? Somewhere between 2^20 and 2^31 seems fine, but towards the latter seems a bit overboard.

thanks @tryphe changed for the standard size limit. Yes, hard question about what number should be there. \nWhat rpc command should be the largest one? Maybe importblock with a full block?\n16MB should be fine?

I think it's hard to answer that. If we make it just big enough for the biggest command we can come up with, someone will come up with a bigger one. I also don't see any way someone could accidentally paste 2GB of data in the textbox, which at worst would just make things a bit slow. I opt to wait for more comments to see if anyone objects.
